comment._content:

comment._content: So sad that so many young lads died for what?? the bloody idiots and hooligans that live today. God bless lads and hope you have peace where you are

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: This photograph was taken by Alfred William Musto, a 37 year old commercial photographer of Leytonstone, at some time in 1917.  'Alf' Musto (b. 1883) was the son of Alfred George Musto, a Beer House Keeper, of 74 White Horse Lane, Mile End Old Town.  'Alf' originally worked as a barman for his father, before realising the opportunity that commercial photography offered him.  In addition to portraits, from 1898 he took some remarkable photographs on visits to Essex, recording rural and seaside scenes at Mistley, Manningtree and Lawford, and including events such as the celebrations for the coronation of George V in 1907; and the surrender of the German submarine fleet at Harwich in November 1918.  'Alf' Musto was married to Alice (b. 1883) and they had a son, Alfred Andrew, (b.1908).//
